00040 #ifndef __CVMX_LOG_H__
00041 #define __CVMX_LOG_H__
00042 
00043 /**
00044  * @file
00045  *
00046  * cvmx-log supplies a fast log buffer implementation. Each core writes
00047  * log data to a differnet buffer to avoid synchronization overhead. Function
00048  * call logging can be turned on with the GCC option "-pg".
00049  */
00050 
00051 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00052 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-core.h>
00053 #else
00054 #include "cvmx-core.h"
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00058 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00059 extern "C" {
00060 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 /*
00064  * Add CVMX_LOG_DISABLE_PC_LOGGING as an attribute to and function prototype
00065  * that you don't want logged when the gcc option "-pg" is supplied. We
00066  * use it on the cvmx-log functions since it is pointless to log the
00067  * calling of a function than in itself writes to the log.
00068  */
00069 #define CVMX_LOG_DISABLE_PC_LOGGING __attribute__((no_instrument_function))
00070 
00071 /**
00072  * Log a constant printf style format string without arguments
00073  *
00074  * @param format  Constant printf style format string.
00075  */
00076 void cvmx_log_printf0(const char *format) CVMX_LOG_DISABLE_PC_LOGGING;
00077 
00078 /**
00079  * Log a constant printf style format string with 0 to 4
00080  * arguments. The string must persist until the log is read,
00081  * but the parameters are copied into the log.
00082  *
00083  * @param format  Constant printf style format string.
00084  * @param number1 64bit argument to the printf format string
00085  */
00086 void cvmx_log_printf1(const char *format, uint64_t number1) CVMX_LOG_DISABLE_PC_LOGGING;
00087 /**
00088  * Log a constant printf style format string with 0 to 4
00089  * arguments. The string must persist until the log is read,
00090  * but the parameters are copied into the log.
00091  *
00092  * @param format  Constant printf style format string.
00093  * @param number1 64bit argument to the printf format string
00094  * @param number2 64bit argument to the printf format string
00095  */
00096 void cvmx_log_printf2(const char *format, uint64_t number1, uint64_t number2) CVMX_LOG_DISABLE_PC_LOGGING;
00097 /**
00098  * Log a constant printf style format string with 0 to 4
00099  * arguments. The string must persist until the log is read,
00100  * but the parameters are copied into the log.
00101  *
00102  * @param format  Constant printf style format string.
00103  * @param number1 64bit argument to the printf format string
00104  * @param number2 64bit argument to the printf format string
00105  * @param number3 64bit argument to the printf format string
00106  */
00107 void cvmx_log_printf3(const char *format, uint64_t number1, uint64_t number2, uint64_t number3) CVMX_LOG_DISABLE_PC_LOGGING;
00108 /**
00109  * Log a constant printf style format string with 0 to 4
00110  * arguments. The string must persist until the log is read,
00111  * but the parameters are copied into the log.
00112  *
00113  * @param format  Constant printf style format string.
00114  * @param number1 64bit argument to the printf format string
00115  * @param number2 64bit argument to the printf format string
00116  * @param number3 64bit argument to the printf format string
00117  * @param number4 64bit argument to the printf format string
00118  */
00119 void cvmx_log_printf4(const char *format, uint64_t number1, uint64_t number2, uint64_t number3, uint64_t number4) CVMX_LOG_DISABLE_PC_LOGGING;
00120 
00121 /**
00122  * Log an arbitrary block of 64bit words. At most 255 64bit
00123  * words can be logged. The words are copied into the log.
00124  *
00125  * @param size_in_dwords
00126  *               Number of 64bit dwords to copy into the log.
00127  * @param data   Array of 64bit dwords to copy
00128  */
00129 void cvmx_log_data(uint64_t size_in_dwords, const uint64_t * data) CVMX_LOG_DISABLE_PC_LOGGING;
00130 
00131 /**
00132  * Log a structured data object. Post processing will use the
00133  * debugging information in the ELF file to determine how to
00134  * display the structure. Max of 2032 bytes.
00135  *
00136  * Example:
00137  * cvmx_log_structure("cvmx_wqe_t", work, sizeof(*work));
00138  *
00139  * @param type   C typedef expressed as a string. This will be used to
00140  *               lookup the structure in the debugging infirmation.
00141  * @param data   Data to be written to the log.
00142  * @param size_in_bytes
00143  *               Size if the data in bytes. Normally you'll use the
00144  *               sizeof() operator here.
00145  */
00146 void cvmx_log_structure(const char *type, void *data, int size_in_bytes) CVMX_LOG_DISABLE_PC_LOGGING;
00147 
00148 /**
00149  * Setup the mips performance counters
00150  *
00151  * @param counter1 Event type for counter 1
00152  * @param counter2 Event type for counter 2
00153  */
00154 void cvmx_log_perf_setup(cvmx_core_perf_t counter1, cvmx_core_perf_t counter2);
00155 
00156 /**
00157  * Log the performance counters
00158  */
00159 void cvmx_log_perf(void) CVMX_LOG_DISABLE_PC_LOGGING;
00160 
00161 /**
00162  * Display the current log in a human readable format.
00163  */
00164 void cvmx_log_display(void);
00165 
00166 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00167 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00168 }
00169 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00170 #endif
00171 #endif
